social_links.name: github
social_links.title: Check out my Open Source Projects!

questions.question: What do you like doing best?

answer.kristi: I'm happiest when I'm building dynamic, engaging experiences for people on the web.
answer.bill: I like being the man behind the curtain.

questions.question: What are your favorite development tools?

answer.kristi: I love doing front-end development for anything built in Ruby, Python, and lately, NodeJs. I also prefer to work with SASS over plain CSS.

questions.question: What have you been working on lately?

answer.kristi: At work, I have been building mobile-friendly responsive survey "widgets". These are used by thousands of surveyers daily at YouGov across many countries!

questions.question: What do you do for fun?

answer.kristi: I just started CrossFit! I like to work out, play video games (Guild Wars 2!), and paint.
Bill and I have been building a CMS Network for Small Businesses. We have some very enthusiastic clients that have helped us test. It's going great so far!

projects.name: Red Headed Angel
projects.description: A fun remix of a very old picture I painted.

projects.name: "Kiss Kiss"
projects.description: Check out the Timelapse Video of this painting!

projects.name: Image Gallery Widget
projects.description: A Work-In-Progress UI for use in our CMS - a way for users to build a dynamic image gallery.

projects.name: YouGov Research MENA
projects.description: I love this site because with one stylesheet it supports Arabic and English. SASS-based style architecture makes this process very simple.

projects.name: DropWallet (Gem)
projects.description: A RubyGem created to connect to DropWallet’s API, intended to provide Active Record / Active Model feel for connecting to the dropwallet API for DropWallet’s various ruby projects.

projects.name: Checkout Experience
projects.description: DropWallet’s Checkout experience for 3rd party sites, currently slated for deployment to several magazine publisher’s web sites. A responsive interface designed to work with mobile, tablet, and desktop. Written in Ruby, connected to the internal DropWallet API for data access. Ultimately intended to replace multiple dated projects. (link and link)

projects.name: DropWallet API router
projects.description: A Node.JS project designed to route API requests to various endpoints, making them appear as a single system. Built in Cache and Security, keeps as much of the load off the end points as possible.

projects.name: Cartography
projects.description: A simple sitemap generator, designed to build a sitemap XML string... intended to be stored in a database. (A requirement for our Unboxed Network CMS)

projects.name: MultiStripe
projects.description: An API wrapper for Stripe which allows the API key of a request to be specified in a request by request basis while being thread safe.
